lexUnit.name: billet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: lodge (soldiers) in a civilian house

sentence.text: In October 1940 the army billeted an officer in one of the numerous spare rooms .
They billeted the men all over the village and even in our outbuildings here .
It was the old sea captain , in whose house Nils had billeted us , who told us .

On arrival , the various Commandos were billeted in camps along the Suez Canal and discovered that their mission had been overtaken by events .
Crash runways were built nearby for the bombers returning from missions in Europe , and Free French forces were billeted in the village .
A little girl called Jeanne was billeted with us .

I was n't even on that deck ; we were billeted two up from there … ”
The adjutant billeted them separately , each sharing a hut with an experienced pilot .
